alert.note: Alert for Barnes; Benson; Eddy; Griggs; Nelson; Ramsey; Ransom; Sargent (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 22 at 11:44AM CST until December 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northeast and southeast North Dakota. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Saturday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 9 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and/or evening commute and holiday travel. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Becoming stranded is a threat and will lead to life threatening circumstances. Significant drifting of snow may lead to dangerous travel and impassable roads.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. If outside, make sure you wear appropriate winter clothing. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.

area.areaDesc: Barnes; Benson; Eddy; Griggs; Nelson; Ramsey; Ransom; Sargent
